titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Independent Order of Odd Fellows Council 837 minute book 1973.310
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 14:21:17 +0000.

did.unittitle: Independent Order of Odd Fellows Council 837 minute book

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Independent Order of Odd Fellows. Council 837 (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)

did.abstract: The Independent Order of Odd Fellows (IOOF) was an international fraternal organization founded in Baltimore, MD in 1819 and became the first fraternal organization open to both men and women in 1851. This collection contains the handwritten minutes of meetings of the IOOF Council 837 of Brooklyn, N.Y. from 1855 (when it was founded) to 1856 compiled by Secretary Cornelius Stryker.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Independent Order of Odd Fellows Council 837 minute book, 1973.310, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Independent Order of Odd Fellows (IOOF) was an international fraternal organization founded in Baltimore, MD in 1819. It became the first fraternal organization open to both men and women in 1851. The IOOF Council 837 of Brooklyn, N.Y. was formed in 1855.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One bound book containing handwritten minutes of meetings of the IOOF Council 837 of Brooklyn, N.Y. from 1855 to 1856. Minutes detail business discussed, members present, nominations of new members, and initiations. The first page contains a list of officers and committee members. The minutes were compiled by Secretary Cornelius Stryker.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. Wheeler N. Voorhees, date unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1973.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Brooklyn Historical Society holds two additional archival collections on the IOOF in Brooklyn:

list.head: Missing Title
list.item: 1973.163, Independent Order of Odd Fellows Magnolia Lodge No. 166 manuscript, 1870-1875
ARC.147, Fraternal organizations of Brooklyn collection, 1845-1997
